newsitem.title: INDIA: TENNIS-RADULESCU, TILLSTROM SURVIVE EARLY SCARES.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-RADULESCU, TILLSTROM SURVIVE EARLY SCARES.

text.p: Germany's fifth seed Alex Radulescu used his powerful serve to escape from early problems against Goichi Motomura of Japan in the first round of the Madras Open tennis tournament on Monday.
The Romania-born Radulescu, 58th in the world rankings, served 17 aces to prevail 5-7 6-4 6-4 against the resolute 177th-ranked Motomura in a two-hour duel.

Sweden's sixth-seeded Mikael Tillstrom was also stretched to three sets by Egyptian Tamer El Sawy before completing a 5-7 7-5 6-4 win, but eighth seed Lionel Roux of France sailed past Germany's Martin Sinner 6-3 6-4 in 75 minutes.
Oliver Delaitre of France got his act together after dropping the first set to secure a 0-6 6-2 6-4 win against Joost Winnink of Holland in a contest of two qualifiers.
